text:
When starting Tomcat, the server should compile all JSPs in all WEB APPs into 
CLASS files and place it in the default Tomcat Server Work Directory. The next 
startup will check for what files have changed and only compile what is 
needed. This will enable the server to serve JSPs super-fast, even when the 
visitor is the first one to visit a JSP page.

text:
You can precompile your JSPs using JasperC, there's no need for Tomcat itself 
knowing what needs to be (re-)compiled upon startup. You could also add a 
script to call JasperC to compile all JSPS in the relevant webapps upon 
starting Tomcat to achieve your desired behaviour.

Tomcat 5 will also have a deployer component which allows easy compilation of
webapps (Servlets - as long as their source is in /WEB-INF/classes - and JSPs),
in addition to validation, and upload to the server.

The component will be made up of all the Ant tasks available in TC 4.1,
associated with improvements to the manager and deployer on the server side. Its
use is completely optional (you can still deploy webapps without compiling JSPs).

I think that and the JSPC task satisfy the enhancement request.
creator: remm@apache.org
